definitions.definition: a written or printed copy of words that have been spoken

examples.text: The White House posted a transcript of the speech on its website.

definitions.definition: an official record of a student’s work that shows the courses they have taken and the grades they have achieved

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French transcrit, from Latin transcriptum, neuter past participle of transcribere, from trans- ‘across’ + scribere ‘write’. The spelling change in the 15th cent. was due to association with the Latin.
